thread.title: The Real Housewives of Melbourne: New housewife Susie McLean joins 2016 edition
thread.title_full: The Real Housewives of Melbourne: New housewife Susie McLean joins 2016 edition | DailyTelegraph

author: CHARLOTTE WILLIS
title: The Real Housewives of Melbourne: New housewife Susie McLean joins 2016 edition
text:
LOOK out Gina, there’s a new housewife in town.
Foxtel has just announced that socialite Susie McLean will join the cast of The Real Housewives of Melbourne in season three. The “country girl turned Toorak Housewife” will join returning stars Chyka Keebaugh, Gamble Breaux, Gina Liano, Jackie Gillies, Janet Roach, Lydia Schiavello and Pettifleur Berenger.
“Susie exudes elegance and embodies the traditional values and good manners of her rural upbringing,” McLean’s bio reads.
Other Stories Inside the mind of a 9/11 truther World From athlete to high class escort Sport Ministers in damage control over Cabinet ‘dead wood’ purge Nsw 0 comments Matty Johns’ NRL Finals predictions Nrl 0 comments 30 photos we should never forget World ‘Why, why are you doing this?’ World “Having been a fixture of Melbourne society for decades, Susie has a wide circle of friends and is President of the County Women’s Association’s Toorak branch. Susie has a natural love of sport which keeps her in shape and is also a passionate cook and baker.”
McLean was married to former St Kilda Football Club president Roderick ‘Rod’ Butterss for six months, the pair tied the knot in February 2009 but separated in July 2009. Rod later spoke of his 10-year battle with alcoholism, telling the Sunday Herald Sun in 2014 “they were dark years”.
Grant Hackett’s ex-wife Candice Alley was also reportedly in talks with the show’s producers to become a new cast member. Deborah Miller’s name was also thrown about. Miller runs the Miss Universe Australia pageant and has been responsible for launching the careers of Jesinta Campbell, Rachael Finch and Scherri-Lee Biggs.
Shooting for season three is already underway in Melbourne.
Originally published as Real Housewives adds ‘country girl’
